tool.name: Symmetrize dinucleotide frequency profiles
tool.help:
CALL sh dnp-symmetrize.sh symmetrize-input.tabular symmetrize-output.tabular
INPUT symmetrize-input.tabular - selected length dinucleotide frequency profiles from forward and complementary sequences
OUTPUT symmetrize-output.tabular - symmetrized output
DESCRIPTION Symmetrization of the dinucleotide profiles enhances the patterns with respect to the nucleosome's dyad position. For each dinucleotide its frequency profiles derived from forward and complementary sequences are superimposed with respect to the dyad center. This entails averaging forward and reversed complement profiles of the identified nucleosome position ( selected by dnp-select-range tool) . A column with the position relative to the dyad center is added as a first column.
Example of an input table pos AA.f AC.f AG.f AT.f CA.f CC.f CG.f CT.f ... 20 0.100200 0.084720 0.077200 0.072480 0.066160 0.044160 0.004560 0.060720 21 0.172440 0.024800 0.002080 0.101240 0.131840 0.007200 0.000320 0.095920 22 0.077160 0.096240 0.314320 0.047360 0.012040 0.028560 0.011840 0.013680 ...
Example of a few columns of an output table pos AA AC AG AT ... -73 0.08616 0.08034 0.07146 0.05934 ... -72 0.11976 0.04966 0.03412 0.07274 ... -71 0.07202 0.08882 0.18912 0.0462 ... ...
